section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: BMW maintenance system
section.paragraph: The maintenance system indicates required maintenance measures, and thereby provides support in maintaining road safety and the operational reliability of the vehicle.

Scopes and intervals of the maintenance system may vary according to the national-market version. Replacement work, spare parts, fuels and lubricants, and wear materials are calculated separately. Further information is available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
The maintenance system provides service notifications and thereby provides support in maintaining road safety and the operational reliability of the vehicle.

In some cases, scopes and intervals of the maintenance system may vary according to the country version. Replacement work, spare parts, fuels and lubricants, and wear materials are calculated separately. Further information is available from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

overview.overview-text: Have maintenance and repairs performed at the service center

warning.paragraph: Improperly performed work, in particular maintenance and repair on the high-voltage system, can lead to electric shock. There is a risk of injury, risk of fire and danger to life. Have work on the vehicle, in particular maintenance, repair or changes, only performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Improperly performed work, in particular maintenance and repair on the high-voltage system, can lead to electric shock. There is a risk of injury, fire and danger to life.

The manufacturer of your vehicle recommends that the work on the vehicle, in particular maintenance and repair, be performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.
Have work on the vehicle, in particular maintenance and repair, performed by an authorized BMW i service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Condition Based Service determines the maintenance recommendation using sensors and special algorithms that take into account the operating conditions of the vehicle.
The system makes it possible to adapt the amount of maintenance corresponding to your user profile.
The maintenance recommendation is determined taking into account the individual usage profile of the vehicle.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Information on service notifications can be displayed on the control display.
Additional information:
Service notifications.

section.title: Service data in the vehicle key
section.paragraph: Information on the maintenance recommendations is continuously stored in the vehicle key. The service center can read out this data and suggest a maintenance scope for the vehicle.
Therefore, hand the service advisor the vehicle key with which the vehicle was driven most recently.
Information on the service notifications is continuously stored in the vehicle key. The service center can read this data out and suggest a maintenance scope for the vehicle.
Therefore, hand the service advisor the vehicle key with which the vehicle was driven most recently.

section.title: Stationary periods
section.paragraph: Stationary periods during which the vehicle battery was disconnected are not taken into account.

If this occurs, have an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop update the time-dependent maintenance procedures, such as checking brake fluid and, if necessary, changing the engine oil and the microfilter/activated-charcoal filter.

Have an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop update the time-dependent maintenance procedures, such as checking brake fluid and changing the microfilter/activated-charcoal filter.

section.title: Service Manual
section.paragraph: Have service work performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop and confirmed in the maintenance record. Records of regular maintenance and repair work should be retained.

section.title: Maintenance and repairs
section.paragraph: Have maintenance and repair performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

section.title: Entries
section.paragraph: Performed maintenance work is entered by into the maintenance record and into the vehicle data. As with a service manual, the entries serve as proof of regular maintenance.
If an entry is made in the electronic service history of the vehicle, service-relevant data is stored both in the vehicle and in the central IT systems of BMW AG, Munich.

Data entered into the electronic service history can also be reviewed by the new vehicle owner after a change in vehicle ownership. All authorized service centers and other authorized service centers or repair shops can review the data entered into the electronic service history.

section.title: Contradiction
section.paragraph: The vehicle owner can contact an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop and object to the entry in the electronic service history and the related data storage in the vehicle and data transmission to the vehicle manufacturer with respect to the time during which he owned the vehicle. In this case, nothing is entered into the electronic service history of the vehicle.

section.title: Displays
section.paragraph: Entered maintenance can be displayed on the Control Display.
Additional information:
Service notifications.

section.title: Preparation for the official inspection
section.paragraph: In accordance with the road traffic act, an annual official inspection is mandatory in Japan.
Authorized dealers offer pre-inspections specific to the vehicle for this purpose. Always contact an authorized BMW dealer.
For details on the official inspection and the vehicle maintenance system, refer to the Service Manual included in the delivery.
Your vehicle needs only routine maintenance in order to maintain its exhaust emissions to the level specified.

section.title: Maintenance Booklet for US Models
section.paragraph: Please consult your Maintenance Booklet for additional information on the performance of service and maintenance work.

The manufacturer of your vehicle recommends that maintenance and repair be performed by a service center or another qualified service center or repair shop. Records of regular maintenance and repair work should be retained.

section.title: Maintenance procedures
section.paragraph: Maintenance procedures are located in the technical data and maintenance procedures of the Supplementary Owner's Manual.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Devices connected to the diagnostic socket will trigger the alarm system after locking the vehicle.
Remove devices connected to the diagnostic socket before locking the vehicle.
The vehicle identification number can be read out with tools that conform to ISO 14229.

overview.overview-text: Observe when using the socket for on-board diagnostics

warning.paragraph: Improper use of the diagnostic socket can lead to vehicle malfunctions. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Have service and maintenance work via the diagnostic socket only performed by an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or by other authorized persons. Only connect devices whose use via the diagnostic socket has been tested and is harmless.

The socket for Onboard Diagnosis is an intricate component intended to be used in conjunction with specialized equipment to check the vehicle’s primary emissions system. Improper use of the socket for Onboard Diagnosis, or contact with the socket for Onboard Diagnosis for other than its intended purpose, can cause vehicle malfunctions and creates risks of personal and property damage. Given the foregoing, the manufacture of your vehicle strongly recommends that access to the socket for Onboard Diagnosis be limited to an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop or other persons that have the specialized training and equipment for purposes of properly utilizing the socket for Onboard Diagnosis.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: There is a diagnostic socket on the driver’s side for reading out vehicle data.

item.paragraph: Engine damage that can damage the catalytic converter. Have the vehicle checked immediately.
Emissions are deteriorating. Have the vehicle checked as soon as possible.
Emissions are deteriorating. Have the vehicle checked as soon as possible.
The warning light flashes under certain circumstances:
This indicates that there is excessive misfiring in the engine.

Reduce the vehicle speed and have the system checked immediately; otherwise, serious engine misfiring within a brief period can seriously damage emission control components, in particular the catalytic converter.
Engine damage that can damage the catalytic converter. Have the vehicle checked immediately.
Emissions are deteriorating. Have the vehicle checked as soon as possible.

section.title: Recycling the vehicle
section.paragraph: The manufacturer of the vehicle recommends giving the vehicle at the end of life cycle to one of the recycling centers recommended by the manufacturer. Relevant national legal provisions apply to returns and recycling in general. Information on recycling and sustainability can be found on the manufacturer’s country-specific websites. In addition, more information can be obtained from an authorized service center or another qualified service center or repair shop.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Dispose of these operating instructions in the designated container.

section.paragraph: The vehicle was developed under consideration of future recyclability with respect to the production method and with respect to the selection of materials. The detailed information about vehicle recycling is available on the website under www.bmw.co.jp.
The disposal of the vehicle is regulated by Japanese law. In the event the vehicle is scrapped, contact a waste disposal company to ensure a lawful disposal.
